surge.materials.woodwindfingerings.oboe package¶

Submodules¶

surge.materials.woodwindfingerings.oboe.all_fingerings module¶

surge.materials.woodwindfingerings.oboe.alternate_fingering_map module¶

Pitch name refers to the written (transposed) pitch for the instrument, as opposed to the sounding pitch.

left hand:
thumb: None, I, II index: None, down, half middle: None, down, d, b ring: None, down, cis pinky: None, gis, ees, b, bes, f
right hand:
index: None, down, gis, a middle: None, down, d ring: None, down, f pinky: None, c, cis, ees

surge.materials.woodwindfingerings.oboe.basic_fingering_map module¶

Oboe basic fingering map. Pitch name refers to the written (transposed) pitch for the instrument, as opposed to the sounding pitch.

left hand:
thumb: None, I, II index: None, down, half middle: None, down, d, b ring: None, down, cs pinky: None, gs, ef, b, bf, f
right hand:
index: None, down, gs, a middle: None, down, d ring: None, down, f pinky: None, c, cs, ef

surge.materials.woodwindfingerings.oboe.illustrate_multiphonic_fingering_map module¶

surge.materials.woodwindfingerings.oboe.multiphonic_fingering_map module¶

Oboe multiphonic keys map.

From “Oboe Unbound: Contemporary Techniques” by Libby Van Cleve (p. 43)

Pitch name refers to the written (transposed) pitch for the instrument, as opposed to the sounding pitch.

left hand:
thumb: None, I, II index: None, down, half middle: None, down, d, b ring: None, down, cis pinky: None, gis, ees, b, bes, f
right hand:
index: None, down, gis, a middle: None, down, d ring: None, down, f pinky: None, c, cis, ees
